New Cantera user here. Thought I'd toss this in as an FYI:

I just (successfully) installed Cantera and Python using the Windows 
installer on Sourceforge. But my first attempt to define a fluid 
as "oxygen" met with an error that the "liquidvapor.cti" file could 
not be found.

I did a search and it's not on my hard drive anywhere. I did manage 
to acquire the file from the source code and copied it to the 
appropriate place, but I suspect it was supposed to be in the 
original install.

Secondly, as a former TCC user I wanted to say I miss the site! I 
realize Cantera is more powerful. But I found the interface of the 
old site very useful for quick ideas. If it's offline for good now 
I'm sure I'll not be the only one to miss it. That said, is there any 
plan to make an interface for Cantera that works the way that web 
site did? If it's not being maintained any longer, was it ever 
mirrored anywhere or would you be willing to share the code so it 
could be run locally? It really was the fastest way I've found to do 
lots of small things.

Thanks in advance!
